name: The Dearborn Inn, A Marriott Hotel

reviews.text: I grew up eating at the restaurant for special dinners with my mom and it is still special, 30 years later. Moving to California gave me the opportunity to stay in the hotel. The hotel is beautiful but you have to enjoy history to appreciate the charm of this hotel. We stayed in a basic double room with our daughters as we knew we wouldn't be there often and it was bigger than expected. One phone call gets you additional towels, pillows, and room service. They are dedicated to their customers here. They even allowed us to check in almost 5 hours early for free (we were willing to pay). The bathroom is a little small but they use the space very well. Note: Housekeeping will not even knock on the door if you have your privacy sign up so make sure you take it down before room service/having extra pillows delivered.
reviews.title: Accomodating, comfortable, historic

reviews.text: The Sunday brunch was excellent.
reviews.title: Suite was large enough for our family of 5

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely stay here the next time we visit.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

reviews.text: Clean historic hotel. Asked for 2 rollaways and the room accommodated them, made for a perfect room for our fam of 5. Bathroom was very small, almost too small. But the hotel was historically interesting for my kids.
reviews.title: Charming old hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary Mar 30-Apr 2. It was our first trip to the Detroit area and it was suggested that I find a hotel in Dearborn. I searched for a room via Priceline and got a great rate for The Dearborn Inn. I was thrilled because this was one of the hotels that had been recommended for me.
reviews.title: An Excellent Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel as part of a wedding party and were given a room in the main hotel. The room was nice although VERY small - the king size bed pretty much took up all the space. If you're going to be spending any amount of time in your room you may want to ask for a larger one if possible. It's definitely an older hotel (small rooms, small elevators) but was well kept up. It was surprisingly quiet and we had a great night of sleep. The room was very clean. My only complaint is that the employee at the front desk continually only addressed my husband and only spoke to him, even though the reservation was in my name, I was the one talking to him, and I was the one paying. Oh well! Very close to the Ford plant, and we had a good view of the test track - very cool.
reviews.title: Pretty But Pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night to attend a friend's wedding. Our stay was wonderful! Check-in was easy, and the hotel staff was very friendly. The decor of the hotel reflects the history of the Detroit area and creates a charming atmosphere. Our room was on the 3rd floor; it was spacious and clean. The wedding took place in one of the meeting rooms and was very nicely done. Overall, it was a great stay!
reviews.title: A wonderful night!

reviews.text: This hotel is very pretty and nicely decorated, the rooms are clean and comfortable. I found this to be a good buy for the money, especially given its history and boutique feel. The only downside was that I found the staff to be a little stuffy and not particularly helpful, otherwise, it is a beautiful and comfortable hotel that merits a stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful place, feels like a boutique hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed on a Saturday night. The room was very nice. The only downside was that the brunch is no longer fancy every Sunday, only on holidays. I loved the bed and bedding so much it was like being on a cloud.
reviews.title: Great Stay, the bed was like a cloud

reviews.text: I grew up, quite literally, at The Dearborn Inn. My parents used to dress us up and take us for Roy Rogers/Shirley Temples at The Eagle Tavern and then we would have dinner there. More recently, I stay there whenever I am in the Detroit area on business. One night, my flight was hours late. All the restaurants on the way to the hotel were closed. When I went to the tavern, the kitchen was closed, but the women who works there had them make dinner (burger and fries) for me anyway. It is this type of service that brings me back, again and again.
reviews.title: Your home away from home

reviews.text: I've stayed here twice, about 8 years apart. The first time I was in the main building; average stay - no ups, no downs. This last trip I asked to be moved to one of the little cottages in back.
reviews.title: What A Delight!

reviews.text: The location of the Dearborn Inn is great for visiting TheHenryFord. The hotel will provide shuttle service if you choose not to walk between the hotel and museum. An added plus is the historical ambience of the hotel and the colonial homes that make up the hotel. The staff was welcoming and friendly.
reviews.title: Ok stay at the Dearborn Inn, improvements needed
The home of the Motor Car and not far from Motown, nice Ford history in the hotel..cheap, and good beds and great bistro..
reviews.text: I stayed in a room in one of the historical homes. The sitting room and bedroom were clean and comfortable and the AC was operating fine. I noticed that maintenance in the bathroom tub/shower was another story. It was hard to figure out how the moldy wall conditions were missed by staff - or other guests for that matter. I mentioned the mold to the registration desk and, demonstrating their service interest, they quickly offered to move me to another room. Given that I was staying only one more night, I declined the moved but asked that it be cleaned during the day. The cleaning helped but, frankly, the cracked/worn bath/shower area and grout needed a major restoration.
Marriott needs to increase the frequency of room inspection by management and schedule more frequent bathroom work. This is a great historical hotel and, with its age, requires attentive service.
reviews.title: A oasis in the city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The home of the Motor Car and not far from Motown, nice Ford history in the hotel..cheap, and good beds and great bistro and helpfull staff. Had a steak for breakfast brought to the room once at 6am, fantastic. Plenty of free parking, handsome building, close to the Henry Ford (brilliant), good shopping..
reviews.title: A good stay at the Dearborn Inn

reviews.text: We stayed at the Dearborn Inn for two nights and enjoyed it more then we thought we would. We were attending a wedding being held there.
reviews.title: Great value, great experience!
Terrific hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Dearborn Inn at the last minute, knowing nothing about it, after fleeing a Hampton Inn with uncomfortable beds. The hotel was magnificent. Beautiful public areas, fascinating vintage Ford photos and posters on the walls, lovely landscaped grounds. Our room was small but clean, well layed out with a very comfortable bed, desk which converted to a dining table, and arm chair. Meals at Edison's were delicious. I would go back in a heartbeat.

I stayed here for 2 days at the end of April for a conference that was held in one of the hotel meeting rooms. All the staff was great from the moment that I walked out of the car. The true test is in service recovery and the original room I was assigned seemed to be occupied, but the front desk immediately assigned me to another one without delay.
reviews.title: Excellent Value, Location and meeting amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The meeting rooms and we had were all a very good size and the AV equipment worked. We have 1 dinner, 2 breakfasts and a lunch there. All the food was very good and the wait staff was very attentive. I cannot say there was anything I did not like.
reviews.title: Second stay as good as the first

reviews.text: We were close to the Ford factory and visited the F-150 production line. This was a great place and I highly recommend it .
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again. The grounds are beautiful this time of year. They were taking wedding pictures here one day and it seemed like the perfect location.
reviews.title: Dearborn Inn and Area

description: Retreat to an urban oasis spanning 23 lush acres at The Dearborn Inn, A Marriott Hotel in Dearborn, Michigan. Built on the grounds of Ford Motor Company in 1931, our hotel is ideally located near downtown Detroit and Detroit Metropolitan Airport. In a setting reminiscent of traditional American hospitality, this hotel boasts 229 spacious guest rooms and suites furnished with luxurious bedding. A unique array of accommodations includes the Main Inn, two Colonial lodges and five Colonial guest homes. Amenities include an on-site fitness center, outdoor pool and several nearby golf courses offering ample leisure activity close to major corporations and cultural sites such as The Henry Ford. The AAA Four Diamond, award-winning hotel offers two eateries serving classic American cuisine. Highlighted by more than 17,000 square feet of flexible event space, this historic hotel is perfect for hosting social affairs, intimate weddings or large business events with ease.
